item.title: Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation MovementPadres & Jóvenes Unidos was live.The company, Palantir Technologies, is ICE’s...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation MovementPadres & Jóvenes Unidos was live.

The company, Palantir Technologies, is ICE’s technology backbone, providing the digital infrastructure to surveil, detain and deport immigrants. Palantir’s tool...s have been used to conduct mass workplace raids, including the biggest raid in US history in which 680 people were detained in Mississippi. Palantir moved its headquarters to Colorado this month. Let's show them that they are not welcome in our city and state! We will not let Palantir profile our people and separate our families.

item.title: 🚨 TODAY: Join Coloradans as we refuse to partner with...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement

🚨 TODAY:

Join Coloradans as we refuse to partner with Palantir by giving them a hearty unwelcome!

The company, Palantir Technologies, is ICE’s technology backbone, providing the digital infrastructure to surveil, detain and deport immigrants. Palantir’s tools have been used to conduct mass workplace raids, including the biggest raid in US history in which 680 people were detained in Mississippi. Palantir moved its headquarters to Colorado this month. Let's show them that th...ey are not welcome in our city and state! We will not let Palantir profile our people and separate our families.

Meet outside 1555 Blake Street at 4pm for a socially distant "Unwelcome Party"! MASKS REQUIRED! And Sign this petition to pledge your resistance to Palantir and ICE: https://actionnetwork.org/…/palantir-out-of-colorado-palan…/

See More

TUE, SEP 22

Unwelcome Party for Palantir

1555 Blake St, Denver, CO 80202-1321, United StatesCauses · 436 people

item.title: DACA WAS MADE POSSIBLE BY YOUNG LGBTQ+ IMMIGRANTS. NOW WE MUST...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement

DACA WAS MADE POSSIBLE BY YOUNG LGBTQ+ IMMIGRANTS. NOW WE MUST FIGHT FOR THEM, TOO

"We know this fight is far from over. In many ways, it’s just beginning. DACA was made possible thanks to the organizing efforts of young immigrants, many of them queer, who pushed President Obama to announce it in the summer of 2012...For many of us, including myself, DACA was never the end goal. We knew in 2012 that DACA was supposed to be a stepping stone towards liberation and protection for all our families, especially those who are often deemed not deserving of rights. Our end goal is the safety and liberation of all people, but especially of trans and queer undocumented people."

- Jorge Gutierrez, Familia; Trans Queer Liberation

The Supreme Court upheld the Obama-era policy, but there is still work to be done to protect the most vulnerable among us

mtv.com

DACA Was Made Possible By Young LGBTQ+ Immigrants. Now We Must Fight For Them, Too

The Supreme Court upheld the Obama-era policy, but there is still work to be done to protect the most vulnerable among usThe Supreme Court upheld the Obama-era policy, but there is still work to be done to protect the most vulnerable among us
item.author: Colorado - Familia

item.title: Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement+9Isaias Vazquez is with Bere Ruiz Almanza and 7 others.🌈✊🏽 Yesterday’s action...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement+9Isaias Vazquez is with Bere Ruiz Almanza and 7 others.

🌈✊🏽 Yesterday’s action felt nostalgic for some of us. We got DACA in 2012 by escalating from sharing our stories to protesting, hunger strikes, blocking highway...s, occupying campaign offices.

This is how we wanted to celebrate, and process. This was a statement of solidarity, intersectionality, a reminder that our movement has work to do.

Everything you saw was 100% envisioned and lead by Unafraid Trans, Queer Undocumented, & DACAmented folx. Organized in just 5 days.

Thankful for friends and allies, I wish I could hug you all. This is community!

Please make a donation to help us with some of our expenses, food and materials.

https://secure.actblue.com/donate/pjuaf

Padres & Jóvenes Unidos Action Fund
Text UNDOCU303 to 474747 to keep up with us.

See More

item.title: Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation MovementMijente[See below for English] 🔥👏🏾🔥👏🏾🔥 ¡¡¡VAMOS Jorge...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation MovementMijente

[See below for English]
🔥👏🏾🔥👏🏾🔥 ¡¡¡VAMOS Jorge Gutierrez!!! Así se habla!

Firme la petición para exigir que Univisión y Telemundo deja de alimentar la anti-Ne...gritud: bit.ly/lasvidasnegrasimportan

"Entiendo que va haber mucho dolor en este momento para nuestra comunidad pero también tenemos una responsabilidad de hacer conección de todo lo que está pasando. Por que la comunidad Negra está marchando y protestando en estos momentos? Porque la policía sigue matando a la gente Negra. Porque la patrulla fronteriza está matando a nuestra gente en la frontera entonces mi llamado ahorita en nuestra comunidad es pensar más allá de nosotros, hacer todas las conecciones, tomar las calles, organizarnos para que toda esta violencia puede terminar. Y ustedes como Univisión tienen responsabilidad de contar toda la historia de todo lo que esta pasando así como hablamos de las deportaciones ustedes también tienen que hablar por que la gente sigue muriendo en manos de la policía, particularmente la gente Negra. Ese es mi llamado. En este momento hacer negocio con esta administración es una traición a la comunidad Negra y a las familias que siguen muriendo."

******
Sign the petition to demand Univisión and Telemundo stop their antiBlack coverage: bit.ly/lasvidasnegrasimportan

"I understand that there is going to be a lot of pain right now for our community but we also have a responsibility to make connections between everything that is happening. Why is the Black community marching and protesting right now? Because the police are still killing Black people. Because border patrol is killing our people. So my call to action right now in our community is to think beyond us, make these connections, take to the streets, and organize so that all this violence can end. And you as Univision have a responsibility to tell the whole story of everything that is happening, just like how we talk about deportations, you also have to talk about why people keep dying at the hands of the police, particularly Black people. That is my call to action. Right now doing business with this administration is a betrayal of the Black community and the families that continue to die. "

See More

item.title: On the eighth anniversary of the Deferred Action for Childhood...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement

On the eighth anniversary of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, also known as DACA, we’re releasing this open letter to the immigrant rights movement with a clear demand: not a single person or organization should use the rescission of DACA to seek compromises that further fund any immigration enforcement in exchange for relief for some of us. Do not sell out immigrant communities.

#Undocu303 #DACA
#AbolishPolice #AbolishICE
#ResignTrump #DontLookAway

Padres & Jóvenes Unidos Action FundOn the eighth anniversary of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, also known as DACA, we’re releasing this open letter to…

medium.com

An Open Letter from Undocumented, DACAmented and formerly Undocumented Leaders to the Immigrant…

On the eighth anniversary of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, also known as DACA, we’re releasing this open letter to…On the eighth anniversary of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, also known as DACA, we’re releasing this open letter to…
item.author: Colorado - Familia

item.title: Friends, As we stand in solidarity in the fight for Black lives,...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado - Familia: Trans Queer Liberation Movement

Friends, As we stand in solidarity in the fight for Black lives, thousands of people in the immigrant community also await a Supreme Court decision on DACA with fear and anxiety. This decision can come at any time now.

Today, we ask everyone to join us in a day of action on the day of the SCOTUS decision. No matter what they decide, we will;

Call for Trump to resign,...
Join the fight for Black lives in a demand for local governments to #DefundThePolice departments across the country and reinvest in quality housing and education, financial and economic support, climate justice, healthcare for all, and mental health services and,
Demand the federal government to defund ICE and CBP as a first step to #AbolishICE.

This us an effort and a critical intervention from former Dream movement leaders and some organizations to inspire the DACA community and undocumented communities to take action once the Supreme Court comes down with a decision. We truly believe this opportunity must crack open more commitment and action to show solidarity and support for the Black Lives Matter movement. We must go beyond our own community in this moment and moving forward and demand to #DefundthePolice, #AbolishICE and call for #ResingTrump. Join this call to action and let’s show up and show out.

Please sign up to participate here. We are hosting a call tomorrow to talk get us all going! We will be sending the call info tomorrow morning for those who sign up. DM for more info.

https://docs.google.com/…/1FAIpQLSe0PjgClnSzBkfWqk…/viewform

See More
item.author: Colorado - Familia
